title: What is a common problem in the world today that could be solved with a new invention? - Quora

response.answer_text: As the first poster (Chris Allen) noted, a pervasive problem in today’s world could be solved within just a few years with technology we currently have but aren’t using because of legislatures. But his solution (autonomous vehicles) actually can do far more than just solve traffic. If all new vehicles were autonomous, the following effects would start to ripple across whatever nation implements the requirement: Basic Traffic congestion would ease slightly; Traffic congestion resulting from accidents would decline (as autonomous vehicle ownership rises) over time to nearly nothing, eliminating nearly half of all major traffic congestion incidences (the other half usually being due to storm damage or road work); Road Rage and the frustration of Traffic Congestion would drop tremendously as drivers would be free to text, email, watch videos, and play games will going to their destination; insurance rates would drop (with fewer major accidents, injuries, and deaths); more people would be able to advance in society as the barriers to vehicle ownership would drop (a lot of people could own single or double occupant vehicles, if not for the insurance costs); Driving while intoxicated or under the influence would disappear amongst individuals with autonomous vehicles (Because they aren’t driving and the vehicle performs the same whether you are drunk or not); the incredible number of injuries and deaths that occur each year due to DUIs would dwindle as autonomous vehicle ownership rises; tourist businesses would see profits rise (Parents will be more willing to do “day trips” to tourist locations when they can into the car at 3 am, sleep until they arrive at DisneyWorld at 8 am, then sleep while heading home at 12 am. 10 hours of driving is daunting and dangerous when surrounding a 16 hour day of fun); Taxis will stop being an entry level job as they will become completely autonomous; Long-Haul Truck Driving (aka Semis) will stop being a career (as autonomous vehicles can do it safer and for longer hours) in exchange for Truck Nannies (entry level jobs where someone just sits in the cab and entertains themselves until an accident happens or the vehicle needs to be refueled) which will then be replaced by Full-service Truck Stops every 2 to 4 hours where the attendants refuel autonomous vehicles and verify that everything is in order (with a small side-business of retrieving and fixing vehicles that have broken down); no real change in employment opportunities for automotive mechanics, but increased employment opportunities for autonomous systems repair; and The Elderly and the Disabled will been able to increase their independence as they will no longer be reliant on other people for transportation whether for a job, basic shopping, or amusement. I am sure that I have missed somethings, but I think that is a good start. As to another current issues that could be resolved with up-and-coming technology, Exoskeletons for the disabled and elderly.
